intro: Cohnia neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the tropical rainforests of the region. Its flowers are often small and showy, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Cohnia neocaledonica is considered a vulnerable species.
